intro: Cremospermopsis cestroides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or creeping velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves that are often tinged with red or purple on the underside. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Cremospermopsis cestroides is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
